refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GAppInfo and GAppLaunchContext are used for describing and launching applications installed on the system.

refsect2.title: enum GAppInfoCreateFlags
refsect2.para: Flags used when creating a GAppInfo.

listitem.simpara: Application opens in a terminal window.

refsect2.title: GAppInfo
refsect2.para: Information about an installed application and methods to launch it (with file arguments).

refsect2.title: GAppInfoIface
refsect2.para: Application Information interface, for operating system portability.

listitem.simpara: Gets a string identifier for a GAppInfo.
Gets the name of the application for a GAppInfo.
Gets a short description for the application described by the GAppInfo.
Gets the execuable name for the GAppInfo.
Gets the GIcon for the GAppInfo.
Launches an application specified by the GAppInfo.
Indicates whether the application specified supports launching URIs.
Indicates whether the application specified accepts filename arguments.
Launches an application with a list of URIs.

Returns whether an application should be shown (e.g. when getting a list of installed applications).
FreeDesktop.Org Startup Notification Specification.
Sets an application as default for a given content type.
Sets an application as default for a given file extention.
Adds to the GAppInfo information about supported file types.
Checks for support for removing supported file types from a GAppInfo.
Removes a supported application type from a GAppInfo.

refsect2.title: GAppLaunchContext
refsect2.para: Integrating the launch with the launching application. This is used to handle for instance startup notification and launching the new application on the same screen as the launching window.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_create_from_commandline ()
refsect2.programlisting: GAppInfo* g_app_info_create_from_commandline (const char *commandline, const char *application_name, GAppInfoCreateFlags flags, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Creates a new GAppInfo from the given information.

listitem.simpara: the application name, or NULL to use commandline
flags that can specify details of the created GAppInfo
a GError location to store the error occuring, NULL to ignore.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_dup ()
refsect2.para: Creates a duplicate of a GAppInfo.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_equal ()
refsect2.para: Checks if two GAppInfos are equal.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if appinfo1 is equal to appinfo2. FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_id ()
refsect2.para: Gets the ID of an application. An id is a string that identifies the application. The exact format of the id is platform dependent. For instance, on Unix this is the desktop file id from the xdg menu specification.
Note that the returned ID may be NULL, depending on how the appinfo has been constructed.

listitem.simpara: a string containing the application's ID.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_name ()
refsect2.para: Gets the installed name of the application.

listitem.simpara: the name of the application for appinfo.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_description ()
refsect2.para: Gets a human-readable description of an installed application.

listitem.simpara: a string containing a description of the application appinfo, or NULL if none.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_executable ()
refsect2.para: Gets the executable's name for the installed application.

listitem.simpara: a string containing the appinfo's application binary's name.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_icon ()
refsect2.para: Gets the icon for the application.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_launch ()
refsect2.para: Launches the application. Passes files to the launched application as arguments, using the optional launch_context to get information about the details of the launcher (like what screen it is on). On error, error will be set accordingly.
To lauch the application without arguments pass a NULL files list.
Note that even if the launch is successful the application launched can fail to start if it runs into problems during startup. There is no way to detect this.

Some URIs can be changed when passed through a GFile (for instance unsupported uris with strange formats like mailto:), so if you have a textual uri you want to pass in as argument, consider using g_app_info_launch_uris() instead.

listitem.simpara: TRUE on successful launch, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_supports_files ()
refsect2.para: Checks if the application accepts files as arguments.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the appinfo supports files.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_supports_uris ()
refsect2.para: Checks if the application supports reading files and directories from URIs.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the appinfo supports URIs.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_launch_uris ()
refsect2.para: Launches the application. Passes uris to the launched application as arguments, using the optional launch_context to get information about the details of the launcher (like what screen it is on). On error, error will be set accordingly.
To lauch the application without arguments pass a NULL uris list.
Note that even if the launch is successful the application launched can fail to start if it runs into problems during startup. There is no way to detect this.

listitem.simpara: a GList containing URIs to launch.
TRUE on successful launch, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_should_show ()
refsect2.para: Checks if the application info should be shown in menus that list available applications.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the appinfo should be shown, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_set_as_default_for_type ()
refsect2.para: Sets the application as the default handler for a given type.

listitem.simpara: TRUE on success, FALSE on error.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_set_as_default_for_extension ()
refsect2.para: Sets the application as the default handler for the given file extention.

listitem.simpara: a string containing the file extension (without the dot).
TRUE on success, FALSE on error.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_add_supports_type ()
refsect2.para: Adds a content type to the application information to indicate the application is capable of opening files with the given content type.

listitem.simpara: TRUE on success, FALSE on error.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_can_remove_supports_type ()
refsect2.para: Checks if a supported content type can be removed from an application.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if it is possible to remove supported content types from a given appinfo, FALSE if not.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_remove_supports_type ()
refsect2.para: Removes a supported type from an application, if possible.

listitem.simpara: TRUE on success, FALSE on error.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_all ()
refsect2.para: Gets a list of all of the applications currently registered on this system.

For desktop files, this includes applications that have NoDisplay=true set or are excluded from display by means of OnlyShowIn or NotShowIn. See g_app_info_should_show(). The returned list does not include applications which have the Hidden key set.

listitem.simpara: a newly allocated GList of references to GAppInfos.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_all_for_type ()
refsect2.para: Gets a list of all GAppInfo s for a given content type.

listitem.simpara: the content type to find a GAppInfo for
GList of GAppInfo s for given content_type or NULL on error.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_default_for_type ()
refsect2.para: Gets the GAppInfo that correspond to a given content type.

listitem.simpara: the content type to find a GAppInfo for
if TRUE, the GAppInfo is expected to support URIs
GAppInfo for given content_type or NULL on error.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_get_default_for_uri_scheme ()
refsect2.para: Gets the default application for launching applications using this URI scheme. A URI scheme is the initial part of the URI, up to but not including the ':', e.g. "http", "ftp" or "sip".

listitem.simpara: a string containing a URI scheme.
GAppInfo for given uri_scheme or NULL on error.

refsect2.title: g_app_info_launch_default_for_uri ()
refsect2.para: Utility function that launches the default application registered to handle the specified uri. Synchronous I/O is done on the uri to detext the type of the file if required.

listitem.simpara: TRUE on success, FALSE on error.

refsect2.title: g_app_launch_context_get_display ()
refsect2.para: Gets the display string for the display. This is used to ensure new applications are started on the same display as the launching application.

listitem.simpara: a display string for the display.

refsect2.title: g_app_launch_context_get_startup_notify_id ()
refsect2.para: Initiates startup notification for the applicaiont and returns the DESKTOP_STARTUP_ID for the launched operation, if supported.
Startup notification IDs are defined in the FreeDesktop.Org Startup Notifications standard, at .

listitem.simpara: a startup notification ID for the application, or NULL if not supported.

refsect2.title: g_app_launch_context_launch_failed ()
refsect2.para: Called when an application has failed to launch, so that it can cancel the application startup notification started in g_app_launch_context_get_startup_notify_id().

listitem.simpara: the startup notification id that was returned by g_app_launch_context_get_startup_notify_id().

refsect2.title: g_app_launch_context_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new application launch context. This is not normally used, instead you instantiate a subclass of this, such as GdkAppLaunchContext.
